body.p: Choose a college student at random. Decide whether each of the following is a discrete or continuous random variable:
1. The number of courses the student takes this semester:
4. The number of siblings the student has:
5. The (exact) time the student spends doing school work during a week:
6. The number of alcoholic beverages that the student drinks in a typical week:

response.name: Discrete
response.feedback: Correct. Number of courses is indeed a discrete random variable, since it can take any value from a list of distinct values: 1, 2, 3, 4, etc.

response.name: Continuous
response.feedback: Incorrect. Number of courses is a discrete random variable, since it can take any value from a list of distinct values: 1, 2, 3, 4, etc.

response.name: Discrete
response.feedback: Incorrect. Student's height is a continuous random variable since it can take any value in an interval. It's true that when rounded to the nearest inch (or centimeter) it looks like it is discrete, but the exact height of a person is continuous. You cannot list all possible heights.

response.name: Continuous
response.feedback: Good job! Student's height is indeed continuous, since it can take any value in an interval. It's true that when rounded to the nearest inch (or centimeter) it looks like it is discrete, but the exact height of a person is continuous. You cannot list all possible heights.

response.name: Discrete
response.feedback: Incorrect. Student's exact body temperature is a continuous random variable since it can take any value in an interval. It's true that when rounded to the nearest degree Fahrenheit (or Celsius) it looks like it is discrete, but the exact body temperature of a person is continuous. You cannot list all possible temperatures.

response.name: Continuous
response.feedback: Good job! Student's exact body temperature is indeed a continuous random variable since it can take any value in an interval. It's true that when rounded to the nearest degree Fahrenheit (or Celsius) it looks like it is discrete, but the exact body temperature of a person is continuous. You cannot list all possible temperatures.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Number of siblings is a discrete random variable, since it can take any value from a list of distinct values: 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, etc.
